Valley Forge is a town in southeastern
in the United States. It is home to Valley Forge National Historical Park.

By car, Valley Forge is easily accessible from I-76 via exit 328. However, "•The Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission advises motorists that the bridge carrying Mill Road over the Pennsylvania Turnpike (I-76) in Tredyffrin Township, Chester County will close to local traffic at 9AM on Monday morning, March 21 with a passenger car and truck detour in effect until November."

Nearest airport is Philadelphia International Airport.

value: Valley Forge Trolley Tour and Step-on Tour

, ☎ +1 610-783-1074, [new]. 
"reservations may be made through The Encampment Store Advanced group registration will improve the experience for groups of 10 or more visiting the Park. Knowing when your group is going to arrive will ensure that it will be best accommodated at the Visitor Center, Encampment Store, and Park Theater. The registration service is free, as is admission to all park facilities.Price for ticket: $16: Adults, $13: Students, seniors (62 & over) and active military, $8: Children (11 & under) Simply complete the on-line form; you will receive a registration confirmation within 48 hours. When possible, please try to give us at least 30 days notice of your group’s arrival."

"History of Valley Forge" Trolley Tour''This 90-minute guided tour gives you the full story of the Valley Forge Encampment. Enjoy the expertise of a professional guide on an open-air trolley. Extended guided stops are made at Washington's Headquarters and Muhlenberg's Brigade. Tickets available in the Encampment Store at the Visitor Center. Reserve them in advance" call +1 610-783-1074.1400 Outer Line Drie, King Of Prussia, PA 19406

Get on and off this free shuttle at any indicated stop during operating hours. Bicycle racks are provided on every shuttle.
Shuttles begin running from the Visitor Center and Washington's Headquarter's at 9:00AM, with the last shuttle leaving at 5:40PM. Shuttle Stops: A. Visitor Center- Lower Parking Lot B. Washington Memorial Chapel C. von Steuben Statue/Varnum's Parking Lot D. Washington's Headquarters. Hours 9:00AM- 5:40PM frequency: 20 minutes. Operating 7 days a week, May 29th-September 6th. The Trolly Tour and The Revolutionary Shuttle are wheelchair accessible."
GPS Coordinates: N 40 degrees 6.109' W 75 Degrees 25.342' 1400 North Outer line Drive, King Of Prussia, PA 19406

value: content=Site of famous American Revolutionary War encampment, includes recreated log cabins and George Washington's headquarters.

offers hiking,("Valley Forge National Historical Park contains 28 miles of authorized trail that are popular for hiking, biking and horseback riding" Also activities include: running,horseback riding, bird watching, fishing and bicycling throughout the large park. visitors can have a picnic using tables abd benches found throughout the park. Bicycles are available for rent, depending on season. Also, ther are Interpretice programs and guided tours, which are usually free and good for all ages.

"For the second consecutive summer, Upper Merion Parks and Recreation Department in cooperation with the National Park Service, will present the Junior Ranger Adventure Camp!"

Kids ages 8-12 can spend a week discovering the history and wildlife at Valley Forge National Park and become a Junior Ranger.
name=Home School Day At Valley Forge Park

content=
"Park rangers and costumed interpreters bring the past to life with special programs and hands-on activities designed for school-aged children. Activities are ongoing from 10AM to 2PM beginning at the Visitor Center at with a Soldier-led "march" at 10AM to the Muhlenberg Brigade huts where the remainder of program takes place. In addition to history, the spring session features outdoor activities with park naturalists and volunteers."


2010/2011 Program Dates:
Thursday, October 21, 2010 from 10AM ongoing to 2PM
Thursday, May 12, 2011 from 10AM ongoing to 2PM
